definition: Eight-Nation Alliance, involved in a military intervention in northern China in 1900
to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet

sentences.english: When the 8 armies come into China, the Russian army occupied the Kaiping province.
sentences.chinese: 八國聯軍進入中國時，沙俄軍隊佔領了開平煤礦。

sentences.english: The rebellion failed, however, when Western powers intervened and stopped the revolt.
sentences.chinese: 八國聯軍潰敗，西方勢力調停並結束了這場叛亂。

sentences.english: A second series of destruction followed when eight allied armies put down the Boxer Movement in 1900.
sentences.chinese: 第二次浩劫是1900年的八國聯軍鎮壓義和團運動。

definition: Hunan army, irregular force formed in 1850s to fight the Taiping heavenly kingdom rebellion
to close a country/to exclude foreign contact/closed country (Qing China, North Korea etc)
Manchurian Qing (refers to the Qing dynasty, esp. at its decline, or as an anti-Qing slogan)
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
Treaty of Shimonoseki (1895), concluding the First Sino-Japanese War 甲午戰爭|甲午战争[Jia3 wu3 Zhan4 zheng1]
Feng Yuxiang (1882-1948), warlord during Republic of China, strongly critical of Chiang Kai-shek
